basejump 0.8.2
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Parameters

Source: R/params.R
params.Rd

Parameters

Arguments

alpha

scalar numeric or NULL. Adjusted P value ("alpha") cutoff. If left NULL, will use the cutoff defined in the object.
aspectRatio

scalar integer. Aspect ratio.
assay

scalar. Name or index of count matrix slotted in SummarizedExperiment::assays(). When passing in a string, the name must be defined in SummarizedExperiment::assayNames().
bpparam

bpparamClass. BiocParallel parameter specifying the back-end to be used for computations. See BiocParallel::bpparam() for details.

We recommend one of the following:

  • BiocParallel::bpparam().

  • BiocParallel::SerialParam().

  • BiocParallel::MulticoreParam().
check

boolean. Perform assert checks.
color

ggproto/ScaleDiscrete or NULL. Desired ggplot2 color scale. Must supply discrete values. When set to NULL, the default ggplot2 color palette will be used. If manual color definitions are desired, we recommend using ggplot2::scale_color_manual(). To set the discrete color palette globally, use options(basejump.color.discrete = ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d()).
counts

matrix. Count matrix. Normalized counts are recommended.
countsAxisLabel

string. Counts axis label.
dark

boolean. Plot against a dark background using basejump::theme_midnight() ggplot2 theme.
dimsUse

integer. Vector of length 2 that denotes the columns from the reduced dimension matrix to use for centerX and centerY column calculations. Defaults the first and second dimensions.
dir

string. Directory path.
direction

string. Plot "both", "up", or "down" directions.
ensemblRelease

scalar integer. Ensembl release version (e.g. 90).
envir

environment to use for assignment. Defaults to parent.frame(), which will assign into the calling environment.
expression

string. Calculation to apply. Uses base::match.arg() and defaults to the first argument in the character vector.
file

string. File path.
fill

ggproto/ScaleDiscrete or NULL. Desired ggplot2 fill scale. Must supply discrete values. When set to NULL, the default ggplot2 color palette will be used. If manual color definitions are desired, we recommend using ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(). To set the discrete fill palette globally, use options(basejump.fill.discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d()).
flip

boolean. Flip x and y axes. Recommended for plots containing many samples.
gene2symbol

Gene2Symbol. Gene-to-symbol mappings. Must contain geneID and geneName columns. See Gene2Symbol() for more information.
genes

character. Gene identifiers. It is considered better practice to input the stable gene identifiers from Ensembl (e.g. "ENSG00000000003") and not the (HGNC) gene symbols (e.g. "TSPN6"), if possible.
geom

string. Plot type. Uses base::match.arg() and defaults to the first argument in the character vector.
headerLevel

scalar integer (1-7). Markdown header level.
i

Indices specifying elements to extract or replace. Indices are numeric or character vectors, empty (missing), or NULL. See help(topic = "Extract", package = "base") for more information.
inherits

boolean. Should the enclosing frames of the environment be searched?
interestingGroups

character or NULL. Groups of interest that define the samples. If left unset, defaults to sampleName.
label

boolean. Superimpose sample text labels on the plot.
labelSize

scalar integer. Size of the text label.
lfcThreshold

scalar numeric or NULL. Log fold change ratio (base 2) cutoff threshold. If left NULL, will use the cutoff defined in the object.
legend

boolean. Show plot legend.
level

string. Return ranges as "genes" or "transcripts".
limit

scalar numeric. Threshold to denote on the plot, using a dashed line.
max

scalar numeric. Recommended maximum value cutoff.
min

scalar numeric. Recommended minimum value cutoff.
minCounts

scalar integer. Minimum number of counts per gene in the count matrix.
n

scalar integer. Number to include.
ntop

scalar integer. Number of top genes to label.
object

Object.
organism

string. Full Latin organism name (e.g. "Homo sapiens").
perMillion

boolean. Display as counts per million.
perSample

boolean. Visualize the distributions per sample.
plotlist

list containing ggplot objects.
pointAlpha

scalar numeric (0-1). Alpha transparency level. Useful when there many points in the dataset (e.g. single-cell data), and some points can be masked.
pointColor

string. Default point color for the plot.
pointScalar

scalar integer. Default point size for the plot.
pointsAsNumbers

boolean. Plot the points as numbers (TRUE) or dots (FALSE).
pointSize

scalar numeric. Point size for dots in the plot.
prefilter

boolean. Apply prefiltering to remove zero count genes.
progress

boolean. Show progress, using progress bars.
reducedDim

string. Name of reduced dimension matrix slotted in SingleCellExperiment::reducedDims(). Includes TNSE, UMAP, PCA, for example.
return

string. Return type. Uses base::match.arg() internally and defaults to the first argument in the character vector.
rowRanges

GRanges. Genomic ranges (e.g. genome annotations).
samples

character or NULL. Samples to include.
sigPointColor

character. Color names for labeling upregulated and downregulated genes. Also supports a character string for labeling DEGs with the same color, regardless of direction.
subtitle

string or NULL. Plot subtitle.
title

string or NULL. Plot title.
trans

string. Name of the axis scale transformation to apply. See help("scale_x_continuous", "ggplot2") for more information.
trendline

boolean. Include trendline on plot.
tx2gene

Tx2Gene. Transcript-to-gene mappings.
url

string. Uniform Resource Locator (URL). HTTP or FTP address.
value

Value to assign.
verbose

boolean. Run the function with verbose messages? It is only recommended to enable this when debugging.
x

Object.
...

Additional arguments.

Value

No value.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
